TourStop.Name: Coffee at Paddington's Pastries
TourStop.Description: Start the morning with a jolt of coffee goodness from this trendy shop. Don't miss the Caramel Crater pastry, guaranteed to amp up your morning carb count.

TourStop.Name: Buckingham Fountain
TourStop.Description: Buckingham Fountain is a Chicago landmark and one of the largest in the world. While in operation, the Fountain produces a 150 foot spectacular water display for 20 minutes every hour.

TourStop.Name: Art Institute of Chicago
TourStop.Description: The Art Institute of Chicago is an art museum located in Chicago's Grant Park. It features a collection of Impressionist and Post-Impressionist art in its permanent collection.

TourStop.Name: Lunch at Zekki's
TourStop.Description: On a good day, Chef Mandro Zekki spins a fantastic lunch scene in her signature café. On a great day you'll swoon over the impeccable lunch entries. Try the Sea Dragon Salad or the Scarlet Blossom Penne

TourStop.Name: Cloud Gate Sculpture
TourStop.Description: The iconic Cloud Gate sculpture is a delight for kids and adults alike. Its design was inspired by liquid mercury and the sculpture's surface reflects and distorts the city's skyline. Visitors are able to walk around and under Cloud Gate's high arch.

TourStop.Name: Lurie Garden
TourStop.Description: Lurie Garden is a 2.5-acre (10,000 m2) garden containing a combination of perennials, bulbs, grasses, shrubs and trees. It is the featured nature component of the world's largest green roof.

TourStop.Name: "Pretzels at The Braid Line
TourStop.Description: Sidle up to this open air pretzel bakery and marvel at the creative knots on display. Served with nearly 100 distinct mustard dipping sauces, you've never seen or tasted pretzels like these.
